# Metadata

Metadata is information about your photos: who took them, when, where, copyright, keywords, etc.

This app edits two types of metadata:

## EXIF Fields

Standard format embedded in camera photos. All available fields:

| Field | Description | Example |
|-------|-------------|---------|
| **Artist** | Photographer/creator name | `Jane Doe` |
| **Copyright** | Copyright notice | `© 2025 Jane Doe` |
| **ImageDescription** | What the photo shows | `Portrait session at studio` |
| **UserComment** | Additional notes or comments | `Shot with 50mm lens, f/1.8` |
| **Software** | Software used to edit | `Adobe Photoshop 2025` |
| **Make** | Camera manufacturer | `Canon` |
| **Model** | Camera model | `EOS R5` |
| **DateTime** | Date/time photo taken | `2025:12:08 14:30:00` |
| **DateTimeOriginal** | Original capture date/time | `2025:12:08 14:30:00` |
| **DateTimeDigitized** | Digitization date/time | `2025:12:08 14:30:00` |

**Most commonly used:** Artist, Copyright, ImageDescription

## XMP Fields

Flexible format for extensive metadata. All available fields:

| Field | Description | Example |
|-------|-------------|---------|
| **dc:creator** | Creator/photographer name | `Jane Doe` |
| **dc:title** | Photo title | `Sunset Over Mountains` |
| **dc:description** | Detailed description | `Landscape photo at golden hour` |
| **dc:subject** | Main subject/category | `Landscape Photography` |
| **dc:rights** | Rights holder/copyright | `Jane Doe` |
| **dc:keywords** | Searchable tags (comma-separated) | `landscape, sunset, mountains, nature` |
| **dc:format** | File format | `image/jpeg` |
| **photoshop:Headline** | Short title/headline | `Mountain Sunset` |
| **photoshop:Credit** | Photo credit line | `Photo by Jane Doe` |
| **photoshop:Source** | Source/origin | `Jane Doe Photography` |
| **photoshop:City** | City where taken | `Aspen` |
| **photoshop:State** | State/province | `Colorado` |
| **photoshop:Country** | Country | `USA` |
| **photoshop:Location** | Specific location | `Maroon Bells, Aspen, CO` |
| **photoshop:CaptionWriter** | Caption author | `Jane Doe` |
| **photoshop:Instructions** | Usage instructions | `Credit required` |
| **xmpRights:UsageTerms** | License/usage terms | `Creative Commons BY-SA` |
| **xmpRights:WebStatement** | Rights info URL | `https://example.com/rights` |
| **Iptc4xmpCore:IntellectualGenre** | Genre/category | `Landscape` |
| **Iptc4xmpCore:Location** | Location shown | `Maroon Bells` |
| **Iptc4xmpCore:CountryCode** | ISO country code | `US` |

**Most commonly used:** dc:creator, dc:keywords, dc:description, dc:rights, photoshop:Location

## Creating Templates

Templates save reusable metadata to apply to multiple photos.

**Steps:**
1. Click **Create Template** button
2. Give it a name (e.g., "Travel Photos", "Wedding 2025")
3. Fill in EXIF fields on the left
4. Fill in XMP fields on the right
5. Click **Save Template**

**Edit or Remove:**
- Select template in list
- Click **Edit** to change it or **Remove** to delete

## Template Examples

### Portrait Photography
```
EXIF:
  Artist: Your Name
  Copyright: © 2025 Your Name
  ImageDescription: Professional portrait

XMP:
  dc:creator: Your Name
  dc:keywords: portrait, professional, studio
  dc:description: Professional portrait photography
```

### Travel Photography
```
EXIF:
  Artist: Your Name
  Copyright: © 2025 Your Name
  ImageDescription: Travel photography

XMP:
  dc:creator: Your Name
  dc:keywords: travel, adventure
  dc:description: Photos from [location]
  photoshop:Location: [City, Country]
```

### Event Photography
```
EXIF:
  Artist: Your Name
  Copyright: © 2025 Your Name
  ImageDescription: Event photography

XMP:
  dc:creator: Your Name
  dc:keywords: event, wedding, celebration
  dc:subject: Event Name
  dc:description: [Event details]
```

### Stock Photography
```
EXIF:
  Artist: Your Name
  Copyright: © 2025 Your Name

XMP:
  dc:creator: Your Name
  dc:keywords: keyword1, keyword2, keyword3, keyword4, keyword5
  dc:description: Detailed description for searching
  photoshop:Headline: Catchy title
  xmpRights:UsageTerms: License type
```

## Using Templates

1. Select one or more photos
2. Choose a template from the **Template** dropdown
3. Click **Apply Template**
4. Metadata is added to all selected photos

## What is Merge Mode?

**Merge Mode** (checkbox in Options):
- ✅ Checked: Adds new metadata without removing existing data
- ❌ Unchecked: Replaces all metadata with template data

Use Merge Mode when photos already have keywords or copyright you want to keep.

## Supported Formats

- **JPEG** (.jpg, .jpeg) - Best for metadata
- **TIFF** (.tif, .tiff) - Professional quality
- **PNG** (.png) - Web-friendly
